intro: Himeranthus runcinatus var. caulescens, commonly known as the slender-leafed hime flower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes species such as willows and evening primroses. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. It produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are narrow and linear, with a distinctive waxy coating that helps reduce water loss.
